text: Philip III the Good ( 31 July 1396 in Dijon â€“ 15 June 1467 in Bruges) ruled as Duke of Burgundy from 1419 until his death. He was a member of a cadet line of the Valois dynasty, to which all 15th-century kings of France belonged. During his reign, the Burgundian State reached the apex of its prosperity and prestige, and became a leading centre of the arts. Category:1396 births Category:1467 deaths Category:Counts of Holland
title: Philip the Good
